Details: Founder and crime boss of the Vietnamese Born to Kill gang during the late 1980s and early 1990s , and was one of the largest purveyors of counterfeit watches in the New York counterfeiting industry . Was convicted of murder , extortion , racketeering alongside a multitude of charges in 1992 by a Federal Judge in Brooklyn

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1963 to 1965
Details: Organized crime boss in Boston , Massachusetts in the 1970s and 1980s ; FBI Ten Most Wanted Fugitive until his capture in 2011 ; known as Whitey

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1969 to 1972
Details: Boss of the Gambino Crime Family in New York City from 1985 to 1992 ; convicted of murder , murder conspiracy , loansharking , illegal gambling , obstruction of justice , bribery , and tax evasion in 1992

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1973 to 1975
Details: Former Caporegime and Underboss of the Lucchese crime family in New York City ; portrayed by Paul Sorvino in the 1990 film Goodfellas

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1941 to 1945
Details: New Jersey political boss and racketeer ; served as an inspiration for the character Enoch Thompson , who is portrayed by Steve Buscemi in the HBO television series Boardwalk Empire

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1972 to 1978
Details: Former associate of the Lucchese crime family in New York City ; portrayed by Ray Liotta in the 1990 film Goodfellas

Status: Sentenced to ten years for Highjacking
Details: Associate of the Lucchese crime family in New York

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1967 to 1971
Details: American labor union leader who disappeared in 1975 . Sentence was commuted in 1971

Status: Spent a portion of his sentence at USP Lewisburg ; released in 1996
Details: Former organized crime figure in Baltimore , Maryland ; convicted of heroin trafficking in 1985 ; served as an inspiration for the character Avon Barksdale in the HBO series The Wire
Former mafioso from Providence , Rhode Island ; associate of the Patriarca crime family

Status: Held at USP Lewisburg from 1966 to 1970
Details: Also known as Tony Pro . Was a caporegime of the Genovese crime family New Jersey faction . An associate of Jimmy Hoffa . President of Teamsters Local 560 in Union City , New Jersey

Status: Serving a 25-year prison sentence ; scheduled for release on August 30 , 2024
Details: Succeeded Juan García Ábrego as leader of the Gulf Cartel ; extradited to the U.S. from Mexico in 2007 and pleaded guilty to threatening to murder U.S. law enforcement agents , drug trafficking and money laundering
